Ask HN: What are the best places to find a job? (job boards, slack groups, etc.)
text:
Hey all, I am trying to piece together the best / most pragmatic experience for a job seeker finding a job in startups/tech.

As a developer, I have had a lot of success on AngelList and Slack communities getting interviews.

In particular, the work on climate slack group has been fantastic for connecting with folks hiring.

AngelList is nice because it’s often a conversation with a cofounder right from the beginning.

For me, the best experience is talking to a real person immediately. Not applying to a careers pages and either never hearing back or getting an automated response no with no real feedback.

I was wondering if there are any other tech focused job platforms or communities that are a good experience for candidates.

I am also curious what a “good experience” means to others here.

Show HN: A GPT-3 powered slack app to get data insights using plain English
text:
Hey there! 
We just launched an application that securely connects to a Postgres/MySQL database and allows users to ask questions about their data in plain English, right from slack.
We’d love some feedback - our product is available for a paid subscription but I would more than happy to set anyone interested up with a free trial. 
We appreciate any constructive criticism on this - it certainly has been exciting to see many similar products come out of the woodwork
